===Other=== Shakira was raised as a Roman Catholic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/entertainment/2010-01/19/content_9341103.htm |title=Shopping saviour Shakira |work=China Daily |date=January 19, 2010 |accessdate=March 5, 2010}}</ref> She personally met [[Pope John Paul II]] in 1998, who nominated her a Goodwill Ambassador.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://shakira.wikia.com/wiki/Main_Page |title=Shakira |publisher=Shakira.wikia.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-12}}</ref> She is interested in world history and frequently studies the history and languages of the countries she visits.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2007/09/14/entertainment/main3260953.shtml |title=Shakira Takes History Class At UCLA |publisher=CBS News |date=September 14, 2007 |accessdate=March 5, 2010}}</ref> After her Oral Fixation tour ended in summer 2007, Shakira attended a summer school class in Los Angeles at UCLA Extension, on the History of Western Civilization. She used her middle and last names, Isabel Mebarak, and told the professor she was visiting from Colombia so as to avoid being recognized as a celebrity.<ref>{{Cite journal |title=Shakira estudia historia en UCLA |url=http://www.elpasotimes.com/spanish/ci_6882605 |accessdate=September 14, 2007 |publisher=[[El Paso Times]] |postscript= <!--None-->}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal |title=Shakira Rests Hips to Study at UCLA |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/20768788/ |accessdate=September 14, 2007 |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |postscript= <!--None-->}}</ref> Shakira is a cousin of model and 2005â2006 [[Miss Colombia]], [[Valerie DomÃ­nguez]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.univision.com/content/content.jhtml?cid=737203 |title=Miss Colombia, prima de Shakira Valerie DomÃ­nguez Tarud Miss Colombia 06 |publisher=Univision.com |accessdate=October 31, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.missosology.org/missuniverse06/focusmisscolombia06.html |title=Valerie Dominguez â Missosology.Org |publisher=Missosology.Org |accessdate=October 31, 2009}}{{dead link|date=November 2011}}</ref> Shakira is a great descendant of the royal [[Macedonian Kingdom]] centered in the northeastern part of the [[Greek peninsula]]. According to that, she is also a direct descendant of [[Alexander III of Macedon]] through her father's bloodline of [[Ancient Macedonians|Macedonian]] ancestry.<ref>http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,205343,00.html</ref><ref>http://www.latinamericanpost.com/index.php?mod=seccion&secc=5&conn=5929</ref>
==Style== ===Music and voice=== {{listen |pos=right | filename = OjosAsi.ogg | title = "Ojos AsÃ­" (1999) | description = Shakira is influenced by Arabic music and is one of the first singers to combine Arabian music with Rock and Roll. | format = [[Ogg]] }} Shakira is known to have adopted many genres, including folk, mainstream pop and rock. In an interview with ''Rolling Stone'' she said: "My music, I think, is a fusion of many different elements. And I'm always experimenting. So I try not to limit myself, or put myself in a category, or... be the architect of my own jail".<ref>{{cite web|last=Mim|first=Udovitch|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/articles/story/5931811/qa_shakira|title =Q&A: Shakira â A pop artist with a rock & roll heart |publisher=Rollingstone|accessdate=November 27, 2009}}{{dead link|date=May 2011}}</ref> Her earlier Spanish albums, including ''[[Pies Descalzos]]'' and ''[[Â¿DÃ³nde EstÃ¡n Los Ladrones?]]'' were a mix of folk music and Latin rock, while her cross-over English album, ''[[Laundry Service]]'' and her later albums were influenced by [[pop rock]] and [[pop Latino]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Lechner|first=Ernesto |url=http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/albums/album/314397/review/5941112/laundry_service|title =Shakira: Laundry Service Review|publisher=Rollingstone|accessdate=November 27, 2009}}{{dead link|date=May 2011}}</ref> Her 2009 album, ''[[She Wolf (album)|She Wolf]]'' is more like [[electropop]] and [[dance music]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/features/shakira-lets-out-her-inner-she-wolf-1004012552.story#/features/shakira-lets-out-her-inner-she-wolf-1004012552.story|title =Shakira: The 'She Wolf' Billboard Cover Story|work=Billboard |accessdate=November 27, 2009}}</ref> Her 2010 album, ''[[Sale el Sol]]'', is a return to her beginnings containing ballads such as "Lo Que MÃ¡s" and "Antes de las Seis", rock songs like "Tu Boca" and "DevociÃ³n", and Latin dance songs like "[[Loca (Shakira song)|Loca]]".<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/shakira-plans-november-release-for-sale-el-sol-2060107.html | location=London | work=The Independent | title=Shakira plans November release for 'Sale El Sol' | date=August 23, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sonymusic.de/Shakira/Sale-El-Sol/P/2428016 |title=Shakira â Sale El Sol â Sony Music Entertainment Germany GmbH |publisher=Sonymusic.de |accessdate=October 22, 2010}}</ref>
===Influences=== Shakira has told many interviewers that she has grown fond of listening to [[Music of Asia|oriental music]], which influenced many of her earlier works. For example, Shakira used the [[India]]n theme for her performance of "Hips Donât Lie" at the [[2006 MTV Video Music Awards]] in New York City.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/5313228.stm|title =Shakira's hips Bollywood bound?|publisher=BBC |accessdate=February 3, 2010 | date=September 4, 2006 | first=Monica | last=Chadha}}</ref> She has also been influenced by her Arab heritage, which was a major inspiration for her breakthrough world hit "[[Ojos AsÃ­]]".<ref name=bbc>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4406486.stm|title =Shakira proud of Arab background |publisher=BBC |accessdate=February 3, 2010 | date=November 4, 2005}}</ref> She told Portuguese TV "Many of my movements belong to Arab culture."<ref name=bbc /> She also cites her parents as major contributors to her musical style.<ref name=bbc />
In childhood, Shakira preferred [[rock and roll]] music, listening heavily to her favorite rock bands like [[Led Zeppelin]],<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2002/jun/08/shopping.colombia|title =The poet and the princess|work=Guardian |location=UK |accessdate=June 8, 2002 | date=June 8, 2002}}</ref> [[The Beatles]], [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]], [[The Police]] and [[U2]].<ref>{{cite web| last=Huey|first=Steve | url=http://www.mtv.com/music/artist/shakira/artist.jhtml#biographyEnd|title =Shakira Biography â MTV|publisher=MTV|accessdate=November 27, 2009}}</ref> She lists [[John Lennon]] as her No.1 musical influence. She was also deeply influenced by [[The Rolling Stones]], [[AC/DC]], [[The Who]], [[The Pretenders]], [[Red Hot Chili Peppers]], [[The Cure]], [[Tom Petty]], [[Depeche Mode]], [[The Clash]], [[Ramones]], whose influence can be heard on her many prominent songs.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.dailynews.lk/2009/01/24/fea21.pdf|title=Mini Biography â Shakira |publisher=Dailynews|format=PDF|accessdate=June 8, 2002}}</ref> In a recent interview to ''Elenco'' magazine, she noted that in her opinion the perfect songs are "[[Imagine (song)|Imagine]]" by John Lennon and "[[No Woman, No Cry]]" by [[Bob Marley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.power96.com/index.php?page=675&sid=8hii21k1ogprbnldk2quv3eo268oo27i |title=POWER 96 |publisher=POWER 96 |accessdate=March 5, 2010}}</ref>
Shakira made several covers of prominent artists such [[AC/DC]] and [[Aerosmith]], using them to sing in her tours, resulting in performances of "[[Back In Black (song)|Back in Black]]"<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.guitarflame.com/2008/top-3-pop-covers-of-acdc-songsceline-dionanastaciashania-twainshakira/|title=Top 3 pop covers of AC/DC songs(Celine Dion&Anastacia,Shania Twain,Shakira) |publisher=Guitarflame.com|accessdate=June 8, 2002}}</ref> and "[[Dude (Looks Like a Lady)]]" during her ''Tour of the Mongoose''. She also sang the classic [[Elvis Presley]] song "[[Always On My Mind]]" at the ''[[VH1 Divas Live]]''.{{Citation needed|date=February 2010}} In her 2010â2011 tour called [[The Sun Comes Out World Tour]], she sings "[[Nothing Else Matters]]" by the [[heavy metal band]] [[Metallica]] in an oriental style. She is also strongly influenced by [[Andean music]] and South American [[folk music]], using her native instrumentation for the Latin dance-pop "Whenever, Wherever" and "Despedida".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thecelebezine.com/s/Shakira |title=Shakira |publisher=Thecelebezine.com |date=February 8, 2010 |accessdate=March 5, 2010}}{{dead link|date=November 2011}}</ref> Shakira recently{{when|date=April 2011}} performed two songs for two separate Haiti benefit events: "I'll Stand By You", by [[The Pretenders]], and "SÃ³lo le pido a Dios" by [[LeÃ³n Gieco]].
In terms of [[Rock en EspaÃ±ol|Spanish language rock]] Shakira is indebited to the [[Argentine rock]] [[power trio]] [[Soda Stereo]] and to the Mexican American band [[Santana (band)|Santana]].
{{quote|I have been a [[Gustavo Cerati|Cerati]] fan all my life when he was part of [[Soda Stereo]] and before knowing him I had already gone to three of his concerts. Both Gustavo [Cerati] and [[Santana (band)|Santana]] has enriched me, they are my small wonders.|Shakira, 2006<ref>Original quote: "Toda mi vida he sido fan de Cerati cuando Ã©l formaba parte de Soda Stereo y antes de conocerlo ya habÃ­a ido a tres de sus conciertos. Tanto Gustavo como Santana me han enriquecido, son mis pequeÃ±os milagros." [http://www.cronica.com.mx/nota.php?id_nota=254425]</ref>}}
==Records and achievements== {{prose|section|date=April 2011}} * According to Sony, Shakira is the highest-selling Colombian artist of all time, having sold more than 60 million albums worldwide.<ref name="BMI.com">{{cite web|title=Shakira â Sale El Sol (Spanish Version) Pop|url=http://translate.google.com.ar/translate?hl=es&sl=ja&tl=en&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sonymusicshop.jp%2Fm%2Fitem%2FitemShw.php%3Fsite%3DS%26ima%3D3317%26cd%3D00DX000077433 |publisher=BMI.com |date=July 30, 2007 |accessdate=August 10, 2010}}</ref> * According to Nielsen Broadcast Data Systems, "[[Hips Don't Lie]]" was the most-played pop song in a single week in American radio history. It was played 9,637 times in one week.<ref name="contactmusic.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/new/xmlfeed.nsf/mndwebpages/shakira%20scores%20most-played%20record_05_06_2006 |title=Shakira â Shakira Scores Most-Played Record |publisher=Contactmusic.com |accessdate=October 31, 2009}}</ref> * Shakira became the first artist in the history of the Billboard charts to earn the coveted number one spots on both the Top 40 Mainstream and Latin Chart in the same week doing so with "Hips Don't Lie".<ref name="contactmusic.com"/>
* "[[La Tortura]]" broke the record on the Billboard's Hot Latin Tracks chart, appearing at No.1 more than any other single (a total of 25 non-consecutive weeks).<ref>{{cite web|author=Up for DiscussionPost Comment |url=http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003157208#/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003157208 |title=Shakira Dominates Latin Grammy Nominations |work=Billboard |accessdate=January 7, 2010}}</ref> * According to [[Yahoo!]], "[[Hips Don't Lie]]" is the Best-Selling Single of the Last 10 Years.<ref name=dominate/> * According to Forbes Magazine, Shakira was the fourth highest-earning woman in music for 2008 behind [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Barbra Streisand]] and [[Celine Dion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-01/31/content_7529683.htm |title=Madonna tops list of 20 richest women in music industry |publisher=News.Xinhuanet.com |date=January 31, 2008 |accessdate=October 31, 2009}}</ref> * According to [[Nokia]] in 2010, there were more Shakira music downloads in the prior year than for any other Latino artist in the last five years, and ''[[She Wolf (song)|She Wolf]]'' topped the Top 10 Latino downloads.<ref>{{cite web|first=Barber|url=http://www.themusicmagazine.co.uk/shakira-most-downloaded-latin-artist/comment-page-1#comment-922 |title=Shakira Most Downloaded Latin Artist|publisher=Themusicmagazine |date=May 3, 2010 |accessdate=May 3, 2010}}</ref> * Additionally, she is the only artist from South America to reach the number-one spot on the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100]], the Australian [[ARIA Charts|ARIA]] chart, and the [[UK Singles Chart]].<ref name="BBC - music shakira">{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/artists/bf24ca37-25f4-4e34-9aec-460b94364cfc |title=BBC â Music -Shakira |publisher=BBC |accessdate=March 20, 2010}}</ref> * Shakira was to be given a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] in 2004, but turned the offer down citing that she did not want to be considered a star of Hollywood.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://breakingnews.iol.ie/entertainment/story.asp?j=259023634&p=z59xz434x |title= New addition to Hollywood walk revealed |work=Ireland On-line |date=June 21, 2008 |accessdate=October 31, 2009}}{{dead link|date=May 2011}}</ref><ref name="hwf star">{{cite web |url=http://hollywoodchamber.net/icons/walk_of_fame.asp |title=Recent Walk of Fame Recipients |publisher=Hollywood Chamber of Commerce |accessdate=June 24, 2009}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> In 2011, it was revealed that Shakira received a star on the Hollywood Walk of fame on November 8, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.shakira.com/news/title/shakira-to-be-honored-with-star-on-the-hollywood-walk-of-fame |title=> News > Shakira to be honored with star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame |publisher=Shakira.com |date=2011-11-01 |accessdate=2011-11-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Posted on Nov 10th by Ramon |url=http://shakiramedia.com/news/detail/1045 |title=News - Shakira to be honored with star on the Hollywood Walk Of fame |publisher=ShakiraMedia.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-12}}</ref> * In 2010, Shakira was ranked number five on the 'Online Video's Most Viral Artists of 2010' with 404,118,932 views.<ref>{{cite web|first=Barber|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/others/year-end-online-video-s-most-viral-artists-1004134449.story|title=Year-End: Online Video's Most Viral Artists of 2010 |work=Billboard |date=December 10, 2010 |accessdate=February 28, 2011}}</ref> * Shakira has become a YouTube sensation having surpassed 1 billion views on the website with [[Waka Waka (This Time for Africa)|Waka Waka]] accounting for over 250,000,000 views this year alone. She is the third person ever to have done this, after [[Lady Gaga]] and [[Justin Bieber]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.omgmusic.com/news/shakira-reaches-1-billion-views-on-youtube |title=Shakira Reaches 1 billion Views On YouTube |publisher=Omgmusic.com |date=January 26, 2011 |accessdate=May 6, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.popcrunch.com/shakira-1-billion-youtube-views/ |title=Shakira 1 billion YouTube Views! |publisher=Popcrunch.com |date=January 26, 2011 |accessdate=May 6, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{YouTube|pRpeEdMmmQ0&feature=relmfu|"Waka Waka" de Shakira}}</ref> * Shakira was honored at the Latin Grammys on November 9, 2011 as 2011's Latin Recording Person of the Year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://b96.radio.com/2011/11/10/photos-shakira-honored-as-2011-latin-recording-academy-person-of-the-year/ |title=Photos: Shakira Honored As 2011 Latin Recording Academy Person Of The Year |News|date=November 10, 2011|publisher=B96 Chicago}}</ref>
